original: 五分律卷第二十一彌沙塞🔽宋罽賓三藏佛陀什
analyzed: 五分律卷第二十一彌沙塞 宋罽賓三藏佛陀什
translated: Mūlasarvâstivāda-vinaya🔽Translated by Tripiṭaka Master Buddhatrāta of Kaśmīra
and Zhu Daosheng, etc.

original: 第三分之五衣法下爾時舍夷國猶遵舊典，不與一切異姓婚姻。
analyzed: 第三分之五衣法下爾時舍夷國猶遵舊典，不與一切異姓婚姻。
translated: Part 3, Section 5: On Robes, continued. At that time, the Śākya country still followed the old customs and did not marry with other surnames.

original: 波斯匿王貪其氏族，自恃兵強，遣使告言：
analyzed: 波斯匿王貪其氏族，自恃兵強，遣使告言：
translated: King Prasenajit coveted their clan and, relying on the strength of his troops, sent a messenger to say:
If you do not marry me, I will destroy your country.
The Śākyas discussed together:

original: 「當設何方，免彼兇虐，而不違我國之舊典？
analyzed: 「當設何方，免彼兇虐，而不違我國之舊典？
translated: What method can we devise to avoid his cruelty while not violating the old customs of our country?
They all said:

original: 「正當簡一好婢，有姿色者，極世莊嚴，號曰釋種，而以與之。
analyzed: 「正當簡一好婢，有姿色者，極世莊嚴，號曰釋種，而以與之。
translated: We should simply select a good maid with a beautiful appearance, adorn her with the finest worldly ornaments, call her a Śākya, and give her to him.

original: 」如議，即與波斯匿王備禮娉迎。
analyzed: 」如議，即與波斯匿王備禮娉迎。
translated: As discussed, they prepared gifts and betrothed her to King Prasenajit.

original: 後生一男，顏貌殊絕，勅諸相師依相立字。
analyzed: 後生一男，顏貌殊絕，勅諸相師依相立字。
translated: Later, she gave birth to a son with an extraordinary appearance. The king ordered the physiognomists to name him according to his features.
The physiognomists said:

original: 「王本以威，而得其母，依義應當字曰琉璃。
analyzed: 「王本以威，而得其母，依義應當字曰琉璃。
translated: The king originally obtained his mother through his power, according to principle he should be named Virūḍhaka.
When he was eight years old, the king wanted to teach him, and had this thought:

original: 「諸藝之中射為最勝，閻浮提界唯有釋種。
analyzed: 「諸藝之中射為最勝，閻浮提界唯有釋種。
translated: Among all skills, archery is the most excellent. In the world, only the Śākyas have it.

original: 佛為菩薩時射一由旬又一拘樓舍，釋摩南射一由旬，最下手者不減一拘樓舍。
analyzed: 佛為菩薩時射一由旬又一拘樓舍，釋摩南射一由旬，最下手者不減一拘樓舍。
translated: When the Buddha was a bodhisattva, he could shoot one yojana and one krośa. Śākya Mahānāman could shoot one yojana, and the least skilled one could shoot no less than one krośa.
I should have my son study with an outsider!

original: 」即勅大臣子弟侍從太子，就釋摩南請受射法。
analyzed: 」即勅大臣子弟侍從太子，就釋摩南請受射法。
translated: He then ordered the sons of great ministers to accompany the prince and go to Śākya Mahānāman to learn archery.

original: 爾時諸釋新造大堂，共作重要：
analyzed: 爾時諸釋新造大堂，共作重要：
translated: At that time, the Śākyas had just built a great hall and made an important agreement:

original: 「先供養佛及諸弟子，然後我等乃處其中。
analyzed: 「先供養佛及諸弟子，然後我等乃處其中。
translated: First we will make offerings to the Buddha and his disciples, and then we will take up residence in it.

original: 」琉璃太子與其眷屬輒入遊戲，諸釋見之，瞋忿罵言：
analyzed: 」琉璃太子與其眷屬輒入遊戲，諸釋見之，瞋忿罵言：
translated: Prince Virūḍhaka and his retinue suddenly entered to play. The Śākyas saw this and scolded angrily:

original: 「下賤婢子，我不以汝為良福田！
analyzed: 「下賤婢子，我不以汝為良福田！
translated: You are the son of a lowly slave woman! We do not consider you a good field of blessings!

original: 云何世尊未入中坐，而敢在先？
analyzed: 云何世尊未入中坐，而敢在先？
translated: Why did the World-Honored One not enter the hall first, yet dare to sit in it before me?

original: 」琉璃太子即大忿恨，勅一人言：
analyzed: 」琉璃太子即大忿恨，勅一人言：
translated: Prince Vidudabha became greatly angry and ordered a man, saying:

original: 「汝憶在心，我為王時便以白我！
analyzed: 「汝憶在心，我為王時便以白我！
translated: Remember this in your heart! When I become king, report it to me!
He then left.

original: 諸釋於後掘去堂土，更為新地，然後請佛及僧於中設食，演說妙法。
analyzed: 諸釋於後掘去堂土，更為新地，然後請佛及僧於中設食，演說妙法。
translated: The Śākyas later dug out the soil from the hall, made new ground, and then invited the Buddha and the Saṃgha to set up a meal and expound the wonderful Dharma in it.

original: 琉璃太子知射法已，還舍衛城，少年之中便紹王位，先共學人皆居要職。
analyzed: 琉璃太子知射法已，還舍衛城，少年之中便紹王位，先共學人皆居要職。
translated: When Prince Vidudabha had learned archery, he returned to Śrāvastī and, as a young man, immediately succeeded to the throne. The former students all held important positions.
A former minister who had received instruction then said to the king:
Does the king remember when the Śākyas scolded him?
The king said:
I remember!
The minister further said:
If you do not avenge it now, what are you waiting for?

original: 」王聞其語，即嚴四種兵，往伐諸釋。
analyzed: 」王聞其語，即嚴四種兵，往伐諸釋。
translated: Hearing these words, the king immediately equipped the four divisions of his army and went to attack the Śākyas.

original: 世尊聞之，即於路側，坐無蔭舍夷樹下。
analyzed: 世尊聞之，即於路側，坐無蔭舍夷樹下。
translated: The World-Honored One heard this and sat under a shadeless śirīṣa tree by the side of the road.

original: 王遙見佛，下車步進，頭面禮足，白佛言：
analyzed: 王遙見佛，下車步進，頭面禮足，白佛言：
translated: The king saw the Buddha from afar, got down from his carriage, advanced on foot, bowed his head to the Buddha's feet, and said to the Buddha:
World-Honored One!

original: 好樹甚多，何故乃坐此無蔭樹下？
analyzed: 好樹甚多，何故乃坐此無蔭樹下？
translated: There are many good trees. Why did you sit under this shadeless tree?
The World-Honored One replied:
The shade of relatives is pleasant.

original: 」王知佛意愍念諸釋，即迴軍還，如是再反。
analyzed: 」王知佛意愍念諸釋，即迴軍還，如是再反。
translated: The king knew that the Buddha's intention was to have compassion for the Śākyas, so he turned his army back. In this way, he went back and forth twice.

original: 彼臣又復如前白王，王便嚴駕往伐諸釋。
analyzed: 彼臣又復如前白王，王便嚴駕往伐諸釋。
translated: That minister again spoke to the king as before, and the king then prepared his chariot and went to attack the Śākyas.

original: 佛知諸釋宿對叵避，便止不出。
analyzed: 佛知諸釋宿對叵避，便止不出。
translated: The Buddha knew that the Śākyas' past karma was unavoidable, so he stopped and did not come out.

original: 諸釋聞琉璃王來伐其國，亦嚴四兵出相御逆，去一由旬以箭射之，或從耳穿中過，或斷其髮，鏟髮令盡，鬚眉無餘，及諸戰具一時斷壞，而不傷肉。
analyzed: 諸釋聞琉璃王來伐其國，亦嚴四兵出相御逆，去一由旬以箭射之，或從耳穿中過，或斷其髮，鏟髮令盡，鬚眉無餘，及諸戰具一時斷壞，而不傷肉。
translated: The Śākyas heard that King Lañjaka was coming to attack their country, so they also prepared the four divisions of their army and went out to meet him. At a distance of one yojana, they shot arrows at him. Some passed through his ears, some cut off his hair, and some shaved his head completely, leaving no eyebrows or beard, and all his weapons were instantly destroyed, but they did not injure his flesh.
King Virūḍhaka asked his attendants:
How far is it from here to the Śākyas?
They replied:
It is one yojana from here.
The king was greatly frightened and said:

original: 「軍鋒未交，已尚如此，若當相接吾軍敗矣！
analyzed: 「軍鋒未交，已尚如此，若當相接吾軍敗矣！
translated: Even before the battle has begun, it is already like this. If we were to engage in battle, our army would be defeated!
It would be better to return to the country and seek to preserve what we have!
At that time, a minister said:

original: 「釋種皆持五戒，寧失身命，終不害物。
analyzed: 「釋種皆持五戒，寧失身命，終不害物。
translated: The Śākyas all uphold the five precepts. They would rather lose their lives than harm others.
Your Majesty should just advance the army, do not worry about defeat!
The king then followed his advice and ordered the army to advance.

original: 釋種還城，閉門自守，琉璃王遣使語言：
analyzed: 釋種還城，閉門自守，琉璃王遣使語言：
translated: The Śākyas returned to the city and closed the gates to defend themselves. King Virūḍhaka sent a messenger to say:
If you immediately open the gates, there will be those who can be spared.
If I attack and capture you, I will not pardon a single person.

original: 」時目連聞琉璃王欲攻舍夷，白佛言：
analyzed: 」時目連聞琉璃王欲攻舍夷，白佛言：
translated: At that time, Maudgalyāyana heard that King Virūḍhaka wanted to attack the Śākyas and said to the Buddha:

original: 「願佛聽我化作鐵籠，籠彼大城！
analyzed: 「願佛聽我化作鐵籠，籠彼大城！
translated: May the Buddha allow me to transform into an iron cage to encircle that great city!
The Buddha told Maudgalyāyana:

original: 「汝雖有神力，何能改此定報因緣？
analyzed: 「汝雖有神力，何能改此定報因緣？
translated: Although you have spiritual powers, how can you change this retribution caused by karmic conditions?
The Buddha explained this meaning with a verse, saying:

original: 「夫業若黑白，　　終不有腐敗，
analyzed: 「夫業若黑白，　　終不有腐敗，
translated: If karma is black or white, it will never rot.

original: 雖久要當至，　　還在現前受；
analyzed: 雖久要當至，　　還在現前受；
translated: Although it may be long, it must eventually come, and one will receive it in the present.

original: 非空非海中，　　非入山石間，
analyzed: 非空非海中，　　非入山石間，
translated: Not in space, not in the ocean, not entering the mountains or rocks,

original: 莫能於是處，　　得免宿命殃；
analyzed: 莫能於是處，　　得免宿命殃；
translated: There is no place where one can escape the calamities of past lives.

original: 報應之所牽，　　無近遠幽深，
analyzed: 報應之所牽，　　無近遠幽深，
translated: Dragged by the karmic retribution, near or far, deep or shallow,

original: 自然趣其中，　　隨處無不定。
analyzed: 自然趣其中，　　隨處無不定。
translated: One naturally goes there, and there is no fixed place.

original: 」爾時諸釋見彼軍盛，或言開門取全、或言以死固守，紛紜不定，便共行籌，以少從眾。
analyzed: 」爾時諸釋見彼軍盛，或言開門取全、或言以死固守，紛紜不定，便共行籌，以少從眾。
translated: At that time, the Śākyas saw the enemy's great army. Some said to open the gates and preserve what remains, while others said to defend to the death. In disarray, they could not decide. They then held a vote, and the minority followed the majority.

original: 時魔波旬在開門眾中，七反取籌，開門籌多，即便開之。
analyzed: 時魔波旬在開門眾中，七反取籌，開門籌多，即便開之。
translated: At that time, Māra Pāpīyān was among those who voted to open the gates. The votes to open the gates were many, so they immediately opened the gates.

original: 琉璃王得城已，宣令三軍：
analyzed: 琉璃王得城已，宣令三軍：
translated: King Virūḍhaka, having obtained the city, proclaimed to the three armies:

original: 「一切釋種皆悉殺之，若非釋種慎勿有害！
analyzed: 「一切釋種皆悉殺之，若非釋種慎勿有害！
translated: All Śākyas are to be killed, but those who are not Śākyas should be spared.
The three hundred million Śākyas heard this and all held reeds in their hands, saying:
We are Śākyas who hold reeds.
The guards believed them and let them go.

original: 於是釋摩南到琉璃王所，琉璃王以為外家公，白言：
analyzed: 於是釋摩南到琉璃王所，琉璃王以為外家公，白言：
translated: Then Śākya Mahānāma went to King Virūḍhaka, and King Virūḍhaka considered him his father-in-law and said:
Elder,
what wish do you seek?
He replied:
I wish that you would no longer kill my relatives!
The king said:
This cannot be done, seek another wish!
He said again:

original: 「願從我沒水至出，於其中間聽諸釋出，凡得出者不復殺之。
analyzed: 「願從我沒水至出，於其中間聽諸釋出，凡得出者不復殺之。
translated: I wish that from the time I enter the water until I emerge, during that time I may allow the Śākyas to come out, and those who come out will not be killed.
King Virūḍhaka thought:
What is wrong with a moment under the water?
He immediately agreed.

original: 釋摩南便解頭沐沒，以髮繫水中樹根，遂不復出。
analyzed: 釋摩南便解頭沐沒，以髮繫水中樹根，遂不復出。
translated: Śyāmāvatī then untied her hair, washed it, and tied it to the root of a tree in the water, and it did not come out again.

original: 王怪其久，使人入水看之，見其已死，髮繫樹根，以此白王。
analyzed: 王怪其久，使人入水看之，見其已死，髮繫樹根，以此白王。
translated: The king wondered why she was taking so long, so he sent someone into the water to look. They saw that she had already died, with her hair tied to the root of a tree. He reported this to the king.
The king then sighed and said:
You were able to give up your life for your relatives without regret!
He then issued an order to the three armies:
If anyone further kills the Śākyas, they will be punished according to military law.

original: 」時諸比丘聞琉璃王誅殺舍夷國人，以是白佛。
analyzed: 」時諸比丘聞琉璃王誅殺舍夷國人，以是白佛。
translated: At that time, the bhikṣus heard that King Prasenajit had slaughtered the people of the Śākyas. They reported this to the Buddha.
The Buddha told the bhikṣus:
King Prasenajit is foolish!

original: 却後七日，當受害學人罪，其眷屬大小亦俱併命。
analyzed: 却後七日，當受害學人罪，其眷屬大小亦俱併命。
translated: After seven days, he will suffer the punishment for harming a disciple, and his relatives, both young and old, will all die together.
King Prasenajit heard this teaching of the Buddha and thought:

original: 「佛無空言，餘苦尚可，唯畏火燒！
analyzed: 「佛無空言，餘苦尚可，唯畏火燒！
translated: The Buddha does not speak empty words. Other sufferings are still bearable, but I fear being burned by fire!

original: 」即與眷屬乘船入阿夷河，七日期至，水忽暴漲，於是覆沒，一時死盡。
analyzed: 」即與眷屬乘船入阿夷河，七日期至，水忽暴漲，於是覆沒，一時死盡。
translated: He then set sail with his retinue on the Ayi River. After seven days, the water suddenly swelled and the boat capsized, killing everyone on board.

original: 諸釋破滅之餘，被剝赤肉，到諸比丘所語言：
analyzed: 諸釋破滅之餘，被剝赤肉，到諸比丘所語言：
translated: The remaining Śākyas, their bodies stripped and bleeding, came to the monks and said:
We are the Śākya clan, the World-Honored One's relatives.
Please give us some clothes!
The monks did not dare to give them, thinking:
The Buddha has not yet allowed us to give clothes to the Śākyas.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
It is allowed to give them.

original: 」復有五戒優婆塞被剝，來至諸比丘所借衣。
analyzed: 」復有五戒優婆塞被剝，來至諸比丘所借衣。
translated: There were also five precepts upāsakas who had been stripped and came to the monks to borrow clothes.
The monks did not dare to lend them, saying:
The Buddha has not yet allowed us to lend clothes to upāsakas.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
It is allowed to lend them.
If they return, you should take them back;
if they do not return, then give them to the upāsakas.

original: 」時跋難陀為安居施故，二處結安居。
analyzed: 」時跋難陀為安居施故，二處結安居。
translated: At that time, because of the offerings for the retreat, Vadanata made retreat arrangements in two places.
The bhikṣus reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
Both places should each be given half.

original: 」時諸比丘在路行，不收攝衣，曳地污裂。
analyzed: 」時諸比丘在路行，不收攝衣，曳地污裂。
translated: At that time, the bhikṣus were traveling and did not put away their robes, dragging them on the ground and staining them.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
It should not be so. The offense is duṣkṛta!
You should make a bag to store them.

original: 」諸比丘作囊太長，以是白佛，佛言：
analyzed: 」諸比丘作囊太長，以是白佛，佛言：
translated: The bhikṣus made the bag too long. They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
It should not be so!
At the longest, it should reach the navel in front and the waist in the back.

original: 」諸比丘以貴價物作衣囊，以是白佛，佛言：
analyzed: 」諸比丘以貴價物作衣囊，以是白佛，佛言：
translated: The bhikṣus used expensive materials to make robe bags. They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
It should not be so!
You should use coarse materials.

original: 」有諸比丘在路行，趣倩人擔衣，亦趣為人擔，或自失衣、或失他衣。
analyzed: 」有諸比丘在路行，趣倩人擔衣，亦趣為人擔，或自失衣、或失他衣。
translated: There were bhikṣus traveling who asked others to carry their robes, and they also asked others to carry their robes. Sometimes they lost their own robes, and sometimes they lost others' robes.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
This is not appropriate.
If you ask someone to carry your robe, you should first take it out and show it to them;
if someone is carrying your robe, you should take it out and look at it.

original: 」諸比丘盛衣囊中，縫合其口，欲取艱難。
analyzed: 」諸比丘盛衣囊中，縫合其口，欲取艱難。
translated: The bhikṣus put their robes in a bag, sewed the mouth shut, and found it difficult to get them out later.
They reported this to the Buddha, who said:
This is not appropriate.
You should make a belt to tie it.
If it is not always necessary, it is also permitted to sew it.

original: 」諸比丘舉欽婆羅、劫貝衣各著一處，生虫嚙壞。
analyzed: 」諸比丘舉欽婆羅、劫貝衣各著一處，生虫嚙壞。
translated: The bhikṣus hung their kapok and silk robes in different places, and insects ate them and damaged them.
They reported this to the Buddha, who said:

original: 「應以劫貝間欽婆羅，然後用屈尸羅香、那毘羅香、青木香，如是諸香辟虫者著中。
analyzed: 「應以劫貝間欽婆羅，然後用屈尸羅香、那毘羅香、青木香，如是諸香辟虫者著中。
translated: You should put silk between the kapok, and then put in such fragrances as kusha, nāgara, and aquilaria, which can repel insects.

original: 」諸比丘後取衣不復識，以是白佛，佛言：
analyzed: 」諸比丘後取衣不復識，以是白佛，佛言：
translated: The bhikṣus later took the robes and could not recognize them anymore. They reported this to the Buddha, who said:
You should write the name and make a mark.

original: 若比丘舉衣經十二年，不還取者，應集僧平價，作四方僧用。
analyzed: 若比丘舉衣經十二年，不還取者，應集僧平價，作四方僧用。
translated: If a bhikṣu keeps a robe for twelve years and does not return to take it, the assembly should gather and settle the price, using it for the fourfold assembly.

original: 若彼比丘後還，以四方僧物償，若不受者善！
analyzed: 若彼比丘後還，以四方僧物償，若不受者善！
translated: If that bhikṣu returns later and repays with the fourfold assembly's property, if he does not accept it, it is good.

original: 」時阿難得施衣不須，為舍利弗受，即使一比丘持衣與之。
analyzed: 」時阿難得施衣不須，為舍利弗受，即使一比丘持衣與之。
translated: At that time, Ānanda obtained a robe as a gift but did not need it. He accepted it on behalf of Śāriputra and had a bhikṣu take the robe to him.
That bhikṣu thought:
Śāriputra is fortunate to have many offerings, but I have no robe.
I should now take it with the same intention.
He then put it on.
Later he had doubts and told the Buddha. The Buddha said:

original: 「彼雖為受，而未是已捨。🔽若於所與比丘，作同意取受持，非善取受持；
analyzed: 「彼雖為受，而未是已捨。 若於所與比丘，作同意取受持，非善取受持；
translated: Although he accepted it on your behalf, it has not yet been relinquished by you.🔽If you take it with the same intention from the bhikṣu to whom it was given, it is not a good acceptance.

original: 若於所受比丘，作同意取受持，是善取受持。
analyzed: 若於所受比丘，作同意取受持，是善取受持。
translated: If you take it with the same intention from the bhikṣu who received it, it is a good acceptance.

original: 」阿難復得腰繩不須，為阿那律受，亦使一比丘持往，語言：
analyzed: 」阿難復得腰繩不須，為阿那律受，亦使一比丘持往，語言：
translated: Ānanda also obtained a belt that he did not need, so he accepted it on behalf of Anuruddha and told a monk to take it to him, saying:
This belt already belongs to Anuruddha.
That monk also thought as before and later became doubtful.
He told the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
Since he said it already belongs to Anuruddha, it is considered given away.

original: 若於所與比丘，作同意取受持，是善取受持；
analyzed: 若於所與比丘，作同意取受持，是善取受持；
translated: If one takes and keeps it with the consent of the monk to whom it was given, it is properly taken and kept;

original: 若於能使比丘，作同意取受持，非善取受持。
analyzed: 若於能使比丘，作同意取受持，非善取受持。
translated: if one takes and keeps it with the consent of the monk who was sent, it is not properly taken and kept.

original: 」時諸比丘不著襯身衣披僧被，污泥不淨，為鼠嚙壞。
analyzed: 」時諸比丘不著襯身衣披僧被，污泥不淨，為鼠嚙壞。
translated: At that time the monks did not wear undergarments and their robes were soiled and damaged by rats.
They told the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
It should not be so. One who violates this is duṣkṛta.

original: 」時六群比丘作襯身衣，大小如僧祇支，或如泥洹僧。
analyzed: 」時六群比丘作襯身衣，大小如僧祇支，或如泥洹僧。
translated: At that time the group of six monks made undergarments the size of a saṃghāṭī or the size of an antarvāsa.
They told the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
This is not appropriate.
There are three ways to do it:

original: 上者，從覆頭下至踝，舒覆左手掩令等沒；🔽中者，從覆頭下至半脛，舒覆左臂掩等至腕；
analyzed: 上者，從覆頭下至踝，舒覆左手掩令等沒； 中者，從覆頭下至半脛，舒覆左臂掩等至腕；
translated: The upper way is to cover from the head down to the ankles, extend the left hand to cover evenly and submerge;🔽The middle way is to cover from the head down to the middle of the calves, extend the left arm to cover evenly to the wrist;

original: 下者，從覆頭下至膝，舒覆左臂掩等半肘。
analyzed: 下者，從覆頭下至膝，舒覆左臂掩等半肘。
translated: The lower way is to cover from the head down to the knees, extend the left arm to cover evenly half an elbow.

original: 」諸比丘不以襯身衣通覆右肩，而通披僧被，污泥不淨，為鼠所嚙。
analyzed: 」諸比丘不以襯身衣通覆右肩，而通披僧被，污泥不淨，為鼠所嚙。
translated: The bhikṣus did not cover the right shoulder with the undergarment, but wore the saṃghāṭī draped over, which became soiled and was chewed by rats.
They reported this to the Buddha, who said:
This is not appropriate.

original: 」有諸比丘受經時、問訊和尚、阿闍梨時，披僧被，偏袒垂地；
analyzed: 」有諸比丘受經時、問訊和尚、阿闍梨時，披僧被，偏袒垂地；
translated: When the bhikṣus received the sūtras, when paying respects to the preceptor and teacher, they wore the saṃghāṭī draped over one shoulder, hanging down on the ground;

original: 或夜起行，不能收攝，亦委於地，泥土污之。
analyzed: 或夜起行，不能收攝，亦委於地，泥土污之。
translated: Or when getting up to walk at night, they were unable to gather it up, and it also fell on the ground, becoming soiled with mud and dirt.
They reported this to the Buddha, who said:
When receiving the sūtras and paying respects, you should drape it over one shoulder, raising it to keep it off the ground.

original: 夜起時，應收攝通披，勿令污泥。
analyzed: 夜起時，應收攝通披，勿令污泥。
translated: When getting up at night, you should collect and put away the shared robes to prevent them from getting dirty.
The bhikṣus wore the saṃghāṭī and tore it, but did not repair it.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
You should repair it.
They did not know who should repair it.
The Buddha said:
Those who use it during the four months of winter and the three months of summer should repair it.

original: 」有諸比丘於阿練若處住，去時不舉僧臥具，致使爛壞。
analyzed: 」有諸比丘於阿練若處住，去時不舉僧臥具，致使爛壞。
translated: There were bhikṣus living in a secluded place. When they left, they did not take up the saṃgha bedding, causing it to rot and be destroyed.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
You should entrust it to a village.
If there is no place to entrust it, you should return it to the owner of the room.

original: 若有疑畏，聚落人民皆悉移去，亦應運持至安隱處。
analyzed: 若有疑畏，聚落人民皆悉移去，亦應運持至安隱處。
translated: If there are doubts and fears, and the people of the village have all moved away, you should also transport it to a safe place.

original: 」諸比丘不隨後視臥具，致有零落。
analyzed: 」諸比丘不隨後視臥具，致有零落。
translated: The bhikṣus did not look back at the bedding, causing it to be lost.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
You should look back.

original: 」既到安隱處，彼諸比丘不與房住，亦不與房安諸衣物。
analyzed: 」既到安隱處，彼諸比丘不與房住，亦不與房安諸衣物。
translated: When they arrived at the peaceful place, the resident monks did not give them rooms to stay in, nor did they allow them to store their robes and belongings in the rooms.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
They should all be given.

original: 若先處不復立，應即在住處用之；
analyzed: 若先處不復立，應即在住處用之；
translated: If the previous arrangement is no longer valid, they should use it in the room they are staying in;
if it is later reinstated, they should take the rest back;

original: 若已盡無餘，彼處比丘應少多分與。
analyzed: 若已盡無餘，彼處比丘應少多分與。
translated: if it is completely used up with nothing left, the resident monks should give them a large portion.

original: 」有諸比丘以此房臥具，於彼房用。
analyzed: 」有諸比丘以此房臥具，於彼房用。
translated: There were monks who used the bedding in this room in another room.
The owners of the rooms criticized and scolded them, saying:
How can you use the things in my room in another room?
This is theft!
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
It should not be done like that!

original: 」有諸客比丘欲問訊師及受經，著住房臥具至彼房，房主比丘不聽。
analyzed: 」有諸客比丘欲問訊師及受經，著住房臥具至彼房，房主比丘不聽。
translated: There were guest monks who wanted to pay respects to their teachers and receive sutras. They brought the bedding from the resident room to the other room, but the resident monks did not allow it.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
You should first tell the monks in the original room, if they agree, it is good;
if they do not agree, you should also take it with you.

original: 若於彼遠行，應送還本房。
analyzed: 若於彼遠行，應送還本房。
translated: If you go far away from there, you should send it back to the original room.

original: 」有諸比丘著僧衣，入溫室及作食處，入僧中食及左右便利，烟熏污泥。
analyzed: 」有諸比丘著僧衣，入溫室及作食處，入僧中食及左右便利，烟熏污泥。
translated: There were monks who put on the Saṃgha's robes, entered the hot room and the kitchen, entered the Saṃgha to eat, and went to the left and right to defecate, and the robes were smoked and soiled.
They told the Buddha about this, and the Buddha said:
You should not do that!

original: 」有諸病比丘須著至諸處，不敢，以是白佛。
analyzed: 」有諸病比丘須著至諸處，不敢，以是白佛。
translated: There were sick monks who needed to put on the robes to go to various places, but they did not dare. They told the Buddha about this.
The Buddha said:
If you are sick, you are allowed to put on the robes to go to other places, but you should take care of them.
You are only not allowed to wear them when defecating and urinating!

original: 」時六群比丘著上下衣，持廣五指衣片，當三衣而入聚落。
analyzed: 」時六群比丘著上下衣，持廣五指衣片，當三衣而入聚落。
translated: At that time, the group of six monks put on the upper and lower robes, held a piece of cloth five fingers wide, and entered the village as if it were the three robes.
The monks saw this and asked:

original: 「世尊不制，不著三衣，不得入聚落耶？
analyzed: 「世尊不制，不著三衣，不得入聚落耶？
translated: Didn't the World-Honored One establish a rule not to enter the village without wearing the three robes?
The group of six monks then showed them the pieces of cloth and said:
These are our three robes.

original: 」諸長老比丘種種呵責，以是白佛。
analyzed: 」諸長老比丘種種呵責，以是白佛。
translated: The elder monks reprimanded them in various ways and reported it to the Buddha.

original: 佛以是事集比丘僧，問六群比丘：
analyzed: 佛以是事集比丘僧，問六群比丘：
translated: The Buddha assembled the community of monks because of this matter and asked the group of six monks:
Is it really so?
They replied:
It is really so, World-Honored One!
After reprimanding them in various ways, the Buddha told the monks:
It should not be so. One who violates this commits a duṣkṛta offense!

original: 從今聽作上中下三衣，如襯身衣量。
analyzed: 從今聽作上中下三衣，如襯身衣量。
translated: From now on, you are allowed to make three robes of superior, middling, and inferior quality, like the size of the undergarment.

original: 」有一住處僧得可分衣，一比丘持至戒壇上獨取受持。
analyzed: 」有一住處僧得可分衣，一比丘持至戒壇上獨取受持。
translated: There was a dwelling place where the community of monks obtained robes to be distributed. A monk took them to the prātimokṣa platform and alone took possession of them.
He reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
It should not be so. One who violates this commits a duṣkṛta offense!
The present community of monks should distribute them.

original: 」有一上座比丘與諸比丘遊行人間，其中有客、有舊，得可分衣少，不足分。
analyzed: 」有一上座比丘與諸比丘遊行人間，其中有客、有舊，得可分衣少，不足分。
translated: There was an elder monk who was traveling with other monks, some of whom were guests and some were old residents. They obtained some robes that were to be divided, but there were not enough to go around.
They told the Buddha about this, and the Buddha said:
The old monks should tell the guest monks:
'Venerable ones!
This robe is insufficient to be divided.'
If the guest monks say:
'Take it and give it to us together.'
They should take it;
If they say:
'We will not give even a single thread.'
Then they should divide it together.
The guest monks also spoke to the old monks in the same way.

original: 有比丘取覆塚衣，塚主失衣，借問：
analyzed: 有比丘取覆塚衣，塚主失衣，借問：
translated: There were monks who took the shroud from a grave. The owner of the grave lost the shroud and borrowed to ask:
Who took my shroud from the grave?
Someone answered:
The monks took it!
He then scolded angrily:
The monks stole the shroud from my ancestor's grave!

original: 」諸長老比丘聞，以是白佛，佛言：
analyzed: 」諸長老比丘聞，以是白佛，佛言：
translated: The elder monks heard about this and told the Buddha. The Buddha said:
You should not take them.

original: 若聚落移去，於後有者，聽作糞掃衣意取。
analyzed: 若聚落移去，於後有者，聽作糞掃衣意取。
translated: If the village has been moved away, if there are any left behind, you may take them with the intention of making them into discarded robes.

original: 」有諸比丘取神廟中幡蓋亦如是。
analyzed: 」有諸比丘取神廟中幡蓋亦如是。
translated: There were also bhikṣus who took banners and canopies from temples in the same way.

original: 有諸比丘往鬪戰處取死人衣，軍人譏呵言：
analyzed: 有諸比丘往鬪戰處取死人衣，軍人譏呵言：
translated: There were bhikṣus who went to the site of a battle and took the clothes of the dead. The soldiers ridiculed and scolded them, saying:
These bhikṣus want us to kill more people!

original: 」諸長老比丘聞，以是白佛，佛言：
analyzed: 」諸長老比丘聞，以是白佛，佛言：
translated: The elder bhikṣus heard about this and reported it to the Buddha. The Buddha said:
You should not do that!

original: 」有諸比丘少知識，欲鬪戰處取死人衣，不敢往。
analyzed: 」有諸比丘少知識，欲鬪戰處取死人衣，不敢往。
translated: There were bhikṣus with few acquaintances who wanted to take the clothes of the dead from the site of a battle, but they did not dare to go.
They reported this to the Buddha. The Buddha said:
I allow you to take them after the soldiers have left.

original: 」有諸白衣，軍人去後，收斂骨肉尸喪，見諸死尸悉被剝脫，不可復識，便譏呵言：
analyzed: 」有諸白衣，軍人去後，收斂骨肉尸喪，見諸死尸悉被剝脫，不可復識，便譏呵言：
translated: After the soldiers had left, some laypeople collected the bones, flesh, and corpses of the dead. They saw that all the dead bodies had been stripped and could no longer be identified. They then ridiculed and scolded them, saying:
How can the bhikṣus strip the clothes off our relatives?
If there are clothes, they should be identified.
The bhikṣus reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
You should take them when no one is looking.
Taking clothes at the place where people are killed is the same as this.

original: 有諸比丘取死人衣，不壞作比丘衣畜。
analyzed: 有諸比丘取死人衣，不壞作比丘衣畜。
translated: There were bhikṣus who took the clothes of the dead and kept them without destroying them to make bhikṣu robes.
The laypeople saw them and said:
These are the clothes of our relatives!
They then cried out toward them.
The bhikṣus reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
You should quickly destroy them to make bhikṣu robes and keep them;

original: 若鐵器，應速用作大小鉢、戶鉤諸所須物。
analyzed: 若鐵器，應速用作大小鉢、戶鉤諸所須物。
translated: if they are iron utensils, you should quickly use them to make large and small bowls, hooks, and other necessary things.

original: 」有一家大富，賊劫之不能盡持去，留藏糞掃。
analyzed: 」有一家大富，賊劫之不能盡持去，留藏糞掃。
translated: There was a wealthy family that was robbed by thieves. They could not carry it all away, so they left it hidden in the rubbish.

original: 中後還欲取，晝日未敢進，遙伺望之。
analyzed: 中後還欲取，晝日未敢進，遙伺望之。
translated: Later, they wanted to take it back, but they did not dare go during the day. They watched from afar.

original: 有比丘拾糞掃衣，到彼藏物處，見衣角出便取之。
analyzed: 有比丘拾糞掃衣，到彼藏物處，見衣角出便取之。
translated: A bhikṣu picked up a discarded robe and went to the place where they had hidden the items. Seeing a corner of the robe sticking out, he took it.
The thieves watched from afar and said:
Venerable sir!
Do not take my things.

original: 」遭劫家聞，識是賊，縛送官中，官即殺之。
analyzed: 」遭劫家聞，識是賊，縛送官中，官即殺之。
translated: The robbed family heard and recognized him as the thief, bound him and sent him to the authorities, who then executed him.
When the thief was bound, he said:

original: 「若比丘不取我衣，彼何由識我？
analyzed: 「若比丘不取我衣，彼何由識我？
translated: If the monk had not taken my clothes, how would they have recognized me?

original: 是為比丘殺我，非是彼人！
analyzed: 是為比丘殺我，非是彼人！
translated: This monk killed me, not those people!
The monks told the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
If it is heavy when lifted, you should not take it.

original: 」有諸比丘於街巷中視地而行，諸白衣見，或言覓錢、或言覓糞掃衣。
analyzed: 」有諸比丘於街巷中視地而行，諸白衣見，或言覓錢、或言覓糞掃衣。
translated: There were monks who looked at the ground as they walked in the streets, and the laypeople saw them and said they were looking for money or rags.

original: 有一外道弟子以衣裹錢著道中，比丘見拾取，便語眾人言：
analyzed: 有一外道弟子以衣裹錢著道中，比丘見拾取，便語眾人言：
translated: A disciple of a non-Buddhist sect wrapped money in a cloth and placed it on the road. A monk saw it, picked it up, and said to the people:
The monks are indeed looking for money.
The monks told the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
You should not take wrapped objects from the streets.

original: 」有一比丘為衣故至塚間，見一新死女人頭前有函。
analyzed: 」有一比丘為衣故至塚間，見一新死女人頭前有函。
translated: A monk went to a charnel ground to get clothes and saw a new dead woman with a chest in front of her head.

original: 比丘謂是空函，便取持歸，到所住處開視，見有諸嚴身具，不知云何，以是白佛。
analyzed: 比丘謂是空函，便取持歸，到所住處開視，見有諸嚴身具，不知云何，以是白佛。
translated: The monk thought it was an empty chest and took it back to his dwelling place. When he opened it, he saw various ornaments and did not know what to do. He told the Buddha about this.
The Buddha said:

original: 「取時應先開視，若不視取，突吉羅。
analyzed: 「取時應先開視，若不視取，突吉羅。
translated: When taking it, you should first open it to inspect it. If you take it without inspecting it, it is duṣkṛta.

original: 」有諸比丘與外道共道行，為賊所殺。
analyzed: 」有諸比丘與外道共道行，為賊所殺。
translated: Some monks were traveling with non-Buddhists and were killed by thieves.

original: 比丘便取其衣，不壞色作比丘衣。
analyzed: 比丘便取其衣，不壞色作比丘衣。
translated: The monks then took their clothes and made them into monks' robes without changing the color.
Other non-Buddhists saw this and said:

original: 「此是我親里衣，諸比丘必殺而取！
analyzed: 「此是我親里衣，諸比丘必殺而取！
translated: These are the clothes of our relatives. The monks must have killed them to take them!
The monks told the Buddha about this, and the Buddha said:
You should not take them!

original: 若已取，即應壞色作比丘衣。
analyzed: 若已取，即應壞色作比丘衣。
translated: If you have already taken them, you should change the color to make them into monks' robes.

original: 」有諸比丘少欲知足，不受他家施衣。
analyzed: 」有諸比丘少欲知足，不受他家施衣。
translated: There were some monks who were content with few desires and did not accept donations of clothes from other families.
The laypeople discussed this, saying:

original: 「我等何方令彼比丘受我施衣？
analyzed: 「我等何方令彼比丘受我施衣？
translated: What method can we use to make those monks accept our donated robes?

original: 正當裂破、火燒，處處著街巷中，伺其入聚落時，語言：
analyzed: 正當裂破、火燒，處處著街巷中，伺其入聚落時，語言：
translated: We should tear them up, burn them, and scatter them all over the streets and alleys. When they enter the village, we will say to them:
'Look around. If you see anything, take it.'
They did as discussed.
When those monks saw this, they thought:

original: 「我等不受家施衣，必是諸居士為我等作此。
analyzed: 「我等不受家施衣，必是諸居士為我等作此。
translated: We have not accepted donated robes from families. This must be what the laypeople have done for us.
They told the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
You should take them with the thought that they are discarded things.

original: 」有一比丘命過，諸比丘仰著中庭，不以衣覆，露其身體，男根脹起。
analyzed: 」有一比丘命過，諸比丘仰著中庭，不以衣覆，露其身體，男根脹起。
translated: A monk passed away, and the other monks laid him in the courtyard, not covering his body with a robe, exposing his genitals, which were swollen.
The laypeople saw this and criticized him, saying:

original: 「沙門釋子不修梵行，乃使男根如此之大。
analyzed: 「沙門釋子不修梵行，乃使男根如此之大。
translated: The Śramaṇa Buddhists do not practice pure conduct, causing their genitals to be so large.
The monks told the Buddha, and the Buddha said:

original: 「不應仰露，應以衣覆，犯者突吉羅！
analyzed: 「不應仰露，應以衣覆，犯者突吉羅！
translated: You should not do it in the open air, but should cover it with clothes. If you violate this, it is duṣkṛta!

original: 」有一肥大比丘命過，諸比丘舉著生草上，脂出流漫，殺諸生草。
analyzed: 」有一肥大比丘命過，諸比丘舉著生草上，脂出流漫，殺諸生草。
translated: There was a very fat monk who died. The monks put him on living grass. Fat flowed out and killed the living grass.
The non-Buddhist practitioners saw this and criticized:

original: 「沙門釋子自云慈念，而今云何傷殺生命？
analyzed: 「沙門釋子自云慈念，而今云何傷殺生命？
translated: The Śramaṇas, sons of Śākya, claim to have compassion, but now how can they harm and kill living beings?
The monks told the Buddha about this, and the Buddha said:

original: 「不應著生物上，應埋、若火燒、若著石上。
analyzed: 「不應著生物上，應埋、若火燒、若著石上。
translated: You should not put him on living things. You should bury him, burn him with fire, or put him on a rock.

original: 」有一比丘水所㵱殺，衣鉢挂著界內樹枝。
analyzed: 」有一比丘水所㵱殺，衣鉢挂著界內樹枝。
translated: There was a monk who was drowned. His robes and alms bowl were hung on a branch inside the boundary.

original: 諸比丘見，謂入僧界內，應屬僧不敢取。
analyzed: 諸比丘見，謂入僧界內，應屬僧不敢取。
translated: The monks saw it and thought it was inside the Sangha's boundary, so they did not dare to take it.
They told the Buddha about this, and the Buddha said:
You should take it as a discarded robe.

original: 」諸比丘不知有幾種糞掃衣，以是白佛，佛言：
analyzed: 」諸比丘不知有幾種糞掃衣，以是白佛，佛言：
translated: The monks did not know how many kinds of discarded robes there were. They told the Buddha about this, and the Buddha said:
There are ten kinds of discarded robes:

original: 王受位時所棄故衣、塚間衣、覆塚衣、巷中衣、新嫁女所棄故衣、女嫁時顯節操衣、產婦衣、牛嚼衣、鼠嚙衣、火燒衣。
analyzed: 王受位時所棄故衣、塚間衣、覆塚衣、巷中衣、新嫁女所棄故衣、女嫁時顯節操衣、產婦衣、牛嚼衣、鼠嚙衣、火燒衣。
translated: the clothes discarded when the king ascends the throne, the clothes from a charnel ground, the clothes covering a charnel ground, the clothes from the street, the discarded clothes of a newlywed woman, the clothes displayed for chastity at a woman's marriage, the clothes of a woman in childbirth, the clothes chewed by a cow, the clothes gnawed by a rat, and the clothes burned by fire.

original: 」時諸比丘著光色衣，白衣譏呵，以是白佛，佛言：
analyzed: 」時諸比丘著光色衣，白衣譏呵，以是白佛，佛言：
translated: At that time, the bhikṣus wore brightly colored robes. The laypeople criticized and complained about this. They reported this to the Buddha. The Buddha said:
You should not wear brightly colored robes. Those who violate this are duṣkṛtas.

original: 」有比丘畜不滿五肘雨浴衣，以是白佛，佛言：
analyzed: 」有比丘畜不滿五肘雨浴衣，以是白佛，佛言：
translated: There was a bhikṣu who kept a rain bathing robe that was less than five cubits. He reported this to the Buddha. The Buddha said:

original: 「雨浴衣不應減五肘，犯者波逸提！
analyzed: 「雨浴衣不應減五肘，犯者波逸提！
translated: The rain bathing robe should not be less than five cubits. Those who violate this are pāyattikas.

original: 」時諸居士於安居內為兒女剃頭故，以衣施僧。
analyzed: 」時諸居士於安居內為兒女剃頭故，以衣施僧。
translated: At that time, the laypeople, for the sake of shaving their children's heads during the retreat, gave robes to the Saṃgha.

original: 諸比丘受已，欲迴為安居施。
analyzed: 諸比丘受已，欲迴為安居施。
translated: The bhikṣus accepted them and wanted to return them as offerings for the retreat.
They reported this to the Buddha. The Buddha said:
It should not be so!

original: 此名隨事施，現在僧應分，犯者突吉羅！
analyzed: 此名隨事施，現在僧應分，犯者突吉羅！
translated: This is called giving according to circumstances. The present Sangha should divide it. The offender commits a duṣkṛta offense.

original: 」有諸比丘先所受三衣不捨，更受餘衣；
analyzed: 」有諸比丘先所受三衣不捨，更受餘衣；
translated: There were bhikṣus who did not relinquish the three robes they had previously received, but received other robes instead;

original: 以先所受衣淨施及施人。
analyzed: 以先所受衣淨施及施人。
translated: and they gave the robes they had previously received to others for purification and as gifts.
Later, they remembered and told the Buddha. The Buddha said:
It is called receiving again, and it is also called giving for purification and giving to others;
but not relinquishing, one commits a duṣkṛta offense.

original: 」時諸比丘有尼薩耆衣，未捨、未悔過，而為火所燒、水所㵱、賊所奪、失壞，不知云何，以是白佛。
analyzed: 」時諸比丘有尼薩耆衣，未捨、未悔過，而為火所燒、水所㵱、賊所奪、失壞，不知云何，以是白佛。
translated: At that time, there were bhikṣus who had niṣaṇṇā robes that they had not yet relinquished or confessed, and they were burned by fire, washed away by water, stolen by thieves, or lost and destroyed. They did not know what to do, so they told the Buddha.
The Buddha said:

original: 「此即名捨，但應作波逸提悔過。
analyzed: 「此即名捨，但應作波逸提悔過。
translated: This is called relinquishing, but one should confess the pāyantika offense.

original: 」時諸比丘畜衣不以淨施，以是白佛，佛言：
analyzed: 」時諸比丘畜衣不以淨施，以是白佛，佛言：
translated: At that time, there were bhikṣus who kept robes without giving them for purification. They told the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
It should not be so. The offender commits a duṣkṛta offense!
There was a dwelling place where the saṃgha received a gift of brocade.

original: 諸比丘不知云何，以是白佛。
analyzed: 諸比丘不知云何，以是白佛。
translated: The monks did not know what to do and reported this to the Buddha.
The Buddha said:
You should accept it!

original: 迴莊嚴塔、若作塔用、若僧用。
analyzed: 迴莊嚴塔、若作塔用、若僧用。
translated: Use it to repair the stūpa, or for the stūpa, or for the Sangha.

original: 」有一住處僧欲分衣，有少欲比丘不受分，而須腰繩、禪帶、帽、漉水囊。
analyzed: 」有一住處僧欲分衣，有少欲比丘不受分，而須腰繩、禪帶、帽、漉水囊。
translated: There was a dwelling place where the Sangha wanted to distribute robes. A monk with few desires did not accept a share, but needed a belt, meditation belt, hat, and water strainer.
The monks reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
You should give it to him!
After receiving it, he asked for more. They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
When distributing things, you should first ask:
'Do you accept a share?'
If he says he accepts, you should give him an equal share.

original: 若言須腰繩等，應三分與一；
analyzed: 若言須腰繩等，應三分與一；
translated: If he says he needs a belt, etc., you should give him one-third.
If he asks for more, you should not give it to him.

original: 」有一比丘有拘攝，四方僧有僧伽梨，欲貿易之，諸比丘不敢與。
analyzed: 」有一比丘有拘攝，四方僧有僧伽梨，欲貿易之，諸比丘不敢與。
translated: There was a monk who had a robe. The Sangha from the four directions had a saṃghāṭī robe and wanted to trade it with him. The monks did not dare to trade with him.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
I allow you to trade!

original: 若拘攝價多，僧應倍與比丘。
analyzed: 若拘攝價多，僧應倍與比丘。
translated: If the price of the robe is much more, the Saṅgha should give the monk double the amount.

original: 若僧伽梨價多，比丘應倍與僧；
analyzed: 若僧伽梨價多，比丘應倍與僧；
translated: If the price of the saṃghāṭī robe is much more, the monk should give the Saṅgha double the amount;

original: 若貧無物可倍與僧，而必是少欲知足，亦聽與之。
analyzed: 若貧無物可倍與僧，而必是少欲知足，亦聽與之。
translated: if the monk is poor and has no double the amount to give to the Saṅgha, but he is definitely one of few desires and contentment, it is also permitted to give it to him.
The same applies to the remaining robes.

original: 時離婆多比丘苦脚冷，從一婆羅門乞裹脚欽婆羅衣，既乞生疑：
analyzed: 時離婆多比丘苦脚冷，從一婆羅門乞裹脚欽婆羅衣，既乞生疑：
translated: At that time, the monk Revata suffered from cold feet. He begged a brahmin for a piece of felt cloth to wrap his feet. After begging, he had doubts:

original: 「世尊制戒，不聽我等從非親里乞衣，不知云何。
analyzed: 「世尊制戒，不聽我等從非親里乞衣，不知云何。
translated: The World-Honored One has established precepts, not allowing us to beg for robes from non-relatives. I do not know what to do.
He told the Buddha about this, and the Buddha said:

original: 「如是因緣聽乞，所應受持衣，若護𨄔衣、護髀衣、護頭衣、拭手面身體巾等。
analyzed: 「如是因緣聽乞，所應受持衣，若護𨄔衣、護髀衣、護頭衣、拭手面身體巾等。
translated: For such causes and conditions, it is permitted to beg for the robes that should be accepted, such as felt cloth to protect the calves, felt cloth to protect the thighs, felt cloth to protect the head, and towels to wipe the hands, face, and body.

original: 」時諸比丘於僧、四方僧，及塔、不同意人邊，皆作同意取衣。
analyzed: 」時諸比丘於僧、四方僧，及塔、不同意人邊，皆作同意取衣。
translated: At that time, the monks took robes from the Saṅgha, the Saṅgha of the four directions, and from stūpas, and from those with whom they did not agree, all taking them as if they had the agreement.
They told the Buddha about this, and the Buddha said:
This is not appropriate.

original: 於和尚阿闍梨、同和尚阿闍梨、若弟子及諸同意人邊，乃得作同意取。
analyzed: 於和尚阿闍梨、同和尚阿闍梨、若弟子及諸同意人邊，乃得作同意取。
translated: Only with the consent of one's preceptor, teacher, fellow preceptor or teacher, disciples, and those of the same opinion, can one take with mutual consent.

original: 」有諸比丘未命過處分衣物，言：
analyzed: 」有諸比丘未命過處分衣物，言：
translated: There were some monks who, before their lives ended, divided their belongings, saying:

original: 「我死後以此衣物施某甲，以此衣物作如是如是用。
analyzed: 「我死後以此衣物施某甲，以此衣物作如是如是用。
translated: After my death, give this robe to such-and-such a person, and use this robe in such-and-such a way.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
This is not appropriate.
Those who violate this commit a duṣkṛta offense.
Giving is not considered giving, and using is not considered using.

original: 」時阿難常出入蘆夷力士家，後往不在，作同意取貴價劫貝，尋生疑悔，作是念：
analyzed: 」時阿難常出入蘆夷力士家，後往不在，作同意取貴價劫貝，尋生疑悔，作是念：
translated: At that time, Ānanda always went in and out of the house of the Rājagṛha wrestler, and later when he went there he was not there, so he took with mutual consent some expensive silk, and then had doubts and regrets, thinking:

original: 「佛未聽我等於白衣，作同意取衣。
analyzed: 「佛未聽我等於白衣，作同意取衣。
translated: The Buddha has not yet allowed us to take robes with mutual consent from laypeople.
He reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
I also allow you to take robes with mutual consent from laypeople.

original: 」時諸比丘離雨浴衣，不知浴時應著何衣。
analyzed: 」時諸比丘離雨浴衣，不知浴時應著何衣。
translated: At that time, the bhikṣus were separated from their rain retreat bathing robes and did not know what robes to wear when bathing during the rain retreat.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
There are five causes and conditions for being separated from the rain retreat bathing robe:

original: 不雨、不疑雨、不渡水、食病時、作未成。
analyzed: 不雨、不疑雨、不渡水、食病時、作未成。
translated: no rain, no suspicion of rain, no crossing water, eating when sick, and when making but not yet finished.
There are five causes and conditions for being able to keep the saṃghāṭī:

original: 雨時、疑雨、渡水、食病時、作未成。
analyzed: 雨時、疑雨、渡水、食病時、作未成。
translated: during the rainy season, suspicion of rain, crossing water, eating when sick, and when making but not yet finished.

original: 」有一住處僧欲分衣，有客比丘來，諸比丘得分少，不欲分。
analyzed: 」有一住處僧欲分衣，有客比丘來，諸比丘得分少，不欲分。
translated: There was a dwelling place where the saṃgha wanted to distribute robes, and guest bhikṣus came. The bhikṣus got few shares and did not want to distribute them.
They reported this to the Buddha.
The Buddha said:

original: 「乃至得一腰繩直應分，若少不足分，應白二羯磨與一無衣比丘。
analyzed: 「乃至得一腰繩直應分，若少不足分，應白二羯磨與一無衣比丘。
translated: Even if you get the value of a single belt, you should distribute it. If it is insufficient, you should give it to a bhikṣu without robes through a two-part karman.
A single bhikṣu announced:
May the Venerable Saṃgha listen!

original: 此僧得衣、若非衣，今併與某甲比丘。
analyzed: 此僧得衣、若非衣，今併與某甲比丘。
translated: This saṃgha has obtained robes or non-robes, and now they are all given to bhikṣu So-and-so.
If the Saṃgha's time has come and the Saṃgha agrees,
He should say the following.
Venerable monks, listen!

original: 此僧得衣、若非衣，乃至若不忍者，說。
analyzed: 此僧得衣、若非衣，乃至若不忍者，說。
translated: If the Sangha has obtained robes or non-robes, and if you do not agree, speak.
The Sangha has already given the robe to monk so-and-so.
The Sangha approves and remains silent.
This matter is settled in this way.

original: 」6 皮革法五分律第三分之六皮革法佛在舍衛城。
analyzed: 」6 皮革法五分律第三分之六皮革法佛在舍衛城。
translated: The Vinaya in Five Parts, Fascicle Six, Section on Leather Goods, Dharma on Leather Goods, Buddha was in Śrāvastī.

original: 爾時摩訶迦旃延，在阿濕波阿雲頭國波樓多山中住。
analyzed: 爾時摩訶迦旃延，在阿濕波阿雲頭國波樓多山中住。
translated: At that time, Mahākātyāyana was staying on Mount Pāruṣaka in the country of Aśvaka.

original: 彼國有長者名沙門億耳，信樂佛法常供給諸比丘，見法得果，受三歸五戒，恒入僧坊聽受法教。
analyzed: 彼國有長者名沙門億耳，信樂佛法常供給諸比丘，見法得果，受三歸五戒，恒入僧坊聽受法教。
translated: There was an elder in that country named Śramaṇa Śroṇakoṭīviṃśa, who had faith and joy in the Buddha's teachings and always provided for the monks. He saw the Dharma and attained the fruit, received the Three Refuges and Five Precepts, and always entered the monastery to listen to and receive the teachings.
At that time, Śroṇakoṭīviṃśa thought to himself in private:

original: 「如佛所說，在家染著，不能廣修梵行；
analyzed: 「如佛所說，在家染著，不能廣修梵行；
translated: As the Buddha has said, those who stay at home are tainted and attached, and cannot extensively cultivate the holy life;
those who go forth are unattached, like empty space.

original: 我今何不於無為法中，剃除鬚髮，出家學道。
analyzed: 我今何不於無為法中，剃除鬚髮，出家學道。
translated: Why don't I now shave off my beard and hair, go forth, and study the path in the unconditioned Dharma?

original: 」念已，晨旦到迦旃延所，頭面禮足，具宣所念，欲求出家受具足戒。
analyzed: 」念已，晨旦到迦旃延所，頭面禮足，具宣所念，欲求出家受具足戒。
translated: Having thought this, he went to Kātyāyana in the morning, bowed his head to Kātyāyana's feet, and fully expressed his thoughts, wishing to go forth and receive full ordination.
Kātyāyana said:
Being at home and attached, it is truly as you say;

original: 但出家苦節，淨修梵行，獨坐樹下，常應一食。
analyzed: 但出家苦節，淨修梵行，獨坐樹下，常應一食。
translated: But going forth is difficult, purifying one's conduct, and practicing the brahma conduct alone under a tree, one should always eat only one meal.
You were originally wealthy and happy, this matter is very difficult.
Śroṇakoṭīviṃśa, having heard this, returned to his home.

original: 如是至三，見其意至，便與出家。
analyzed: 如是至三，見其意至，便與出家。
translated: In this way, up to three times, seeing his determination, he then allowed him to go forth.

original: 彼國無有十眾，作沙彌經歷六年，迦旃延乃以神通力，於餘國集十眾授具足戒。
analyzed: 彼國無有十眾，作沙彌經歷六年，迦旃延乃以神通力，於餘國集十眾授具足戒。
translated: In that country there were no ten-member assemblies, he became a novice monk and passed six years, Kātyāyana then used his supernormal powers to gather ten-member assemblies from other countries to give him full ordination.
After Śroṇakoṭīviṃśa received the precepts, he thought:

original: 「我聞如來、應供、等正覺，而未奉見，今當往詣問訊世尊。
analyzed: 「我聞如來、應供、等正覺，而未奉見，今當往詣問訊世尊。
translated: I have heard of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, but I have not yet had the opportunity to see him. Now I shall go to the World-Honored One to pay my respects.

original: 」念已，到迦旃延所，頭面禮足，白求詣佛。
analyzed: 」念已，到迦旃延所，頭面禮足，白求詣佛。
translated: Having thought this, he went to Kātyāyana, bowed his head to Kātyāyana's feet, and requested to go see the Buddha.
Kātyāyana said:
Excellent! I rejoice with you!

original: 宜知是時，可以吾名問訊世尊。
analyzed: 宜知是時，可以吾名問訊世尊。
translated: You should know the time has come. You may ask about the World-Honored One on my behalf.
And you may tell the Buddha of five matters:

original: 一、阿濕波阿雲頭國無有十眾，億耳作沙彌經歷六年，不得受具足戒，迦旃延以神通力於餘國集僧，然後得受，願世尊聽此國不滿十眾得受具足戒！
analyzed: 一、阿濕波阿雲頭國無有十眾，億耳作沙彌經歷六年，不得受具足戒，迦旃延以神通力於餘國集僧，然後得受，願世尊聽此國不滿十眾得受具足戒！
translated: First, in the country of Aśvaka and Avyuharāja, there are no ten assemblies. For six years, Śroṇakoṭīviṃśa has been a novice monk and has not been able to receive full ordination. Kātyāyana used his spiritual powers to gather the saṃgha from other countries, and then he was able to receive [ordination]. May the World-Honored One allow those in this country to receive full ordination even if the number is less than ten!

original: 又此國多有沙石棘刺，願聽此國比丘畜重底革屣！
analyzed: 又此國多有沙石棘刺，願聽此國比丘畜重底革屣！
translated: Moreover, in this country there are many sand, stones, thorns and brambles. May the World-Honored One allow the monks in this country to keep heavy-soled leather shoes!

original: 又此國皆以皮敷地，作坐臥具，願聽此國比丘以皮敷地！
analyzed: 又此國皆以皮敷地，作坐臥具，願聽此國比丘以皮敷地！
translated: Also, in this country, people use animal skins as bedding, I wish to request permission for the monks in this country to use animal skins as bedding.

original: 又此國人日日洗浴，願聽此國比丘日日洗浴！
analyzed: 又此國人日日洗浴，願聽此國比丘日日洗浴！
translated: Also, the people in this country bathe daily, I wish to request permission for the monks in this country to bathe daily.

original: 又有比丘寄衣與餘方比丘，衣未至有比丘語所與比丘，比丘生疑恐犯長衣，願為除其此疑！
analyzed: 又有比丘寄衣與餘方比丘，衣未至有比丘語所與比丘，比丘生疑恐犯長衣，願為除其此疑！
translated: There was also a monk who entrusted his robe to another monk in a different place. Before the robe arrived, another monk told the monk who was supposed to receive it. The monk who was supposed to receive it became suspicious and feared he would violate the rule of keeping extra robes. I wish to request the Buddha to resolve this doubt.
Then Eka, having received the instructions, departed.

original: 既到佛所，稽首佛足，宣和尚問訊。
analyzed: 既到佛所，稽首佛足，宣和尚問訊。
translated: When he arrived where the Buddha was, he bowed at the Buddha's feet and conveyed the greetings of his preceptor.
The Buddha said to Ānanda:
You should prepare bedding for this visiting monk.
Ānanda thought to himself:

original: 「佛欲與此比丘共宿故，令我為敷臥具。
analyzed: 「佛欲與此比丘共宿故，令我為敷臥具。
translated: The Buddha wants to stay overnight with this monk, so he is telling me to prepare bedding.

original: 」即於佛房而為敷之，佛與億耳共一房宿，初夜、中夜默然無言。
analyzed: 」即於佛房而為敷之，佛與億耳共一房宿，初夜、中夜默然無言。
translated: He then prepared bedding in the Buddha's room. The Buddha stayed overnight in the same room as Eka. In the first and middle watches of the night, they remained silent without speaking.
In the latter part of the night, the Buddha thought:

original: 「此族姓子威儀調伏，當令說法。
analyzed: 「此族姓子威儀調伏，當令說法。
translated: This son of a good family is disciplined in deportment, I should have him speak the Dharma.
He then said to him:
You may speak the Dharma.

original: 」億耳受教，即說十六義品經，說已默然而住。
analyzed: 」億耳受教，即說十六義品經，說已默然而住。
translated: Eka said, Yes, and immediately spoke the sutra of sixteen meanings. After speaking, he remained silent.
The Buddha said:
Excellent!
Is the language of that country all like this?
He replied:
There are those who are better than me.
He also asked:
Why have you stayed in that country for so long without coming to see me?
He replied:

original: 「我早知欲之過患，有因緣故不得早來。
analyzed: 「我早知欲之過患，有因緣故不得早來。
translated: I knew early on about the faults of desire, but due to circumstances I was unable to come early.
At that time, the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:

original: 「見世之過患，　　身自依法行；
analyzed: 「見世之過患，　　身自依法行；
translated: Seeing the faults of the world, one should personally practice according to the Dharma;

original: 賢者不樂惡，　　為惡不樂善。
analyzed: 賢者不樂惡，　　為惡不樂善。
translated: The wise do not enjoy evil, and those who do evil do not enjoy the good.
At that time, Eka had this thought:

original: 「和尚勅我以五法白佛，今正是時。
analyzed: 「和尚勅我以五法白佛，今正是時。
translated: The master ordered me to tell the Buddha about the five points. Now is the right time.
He then told the Buddha.

original: 佛過夜已集比丘僧，告億耳：
analyzed: 佛過夜已集比丘僧，告億耳：
translated: After the night had passed, the Buddha gathered the assembly of monks and told Ekaśṛṅga:
You may speak again about the five points that Kātyāyanīputra told you.
Ekaśṛṅga then spoke them again.

original: 佛種種讚歎少欲知足、讚戒、讚持戒已，告諸比丘：
analyzed: 佛種種讚歎少欲知足、讚戒、讚持戒已，告諸比丘：
translated: The Buddha praised in various ways the contentment of having few desires, praised the precepts, and praised upholding the precepts. Having done so, he told the monks:

original: 「從今聽阿濕波阿雲頭國及一切邊地少比丘處，持律五人授具足戒；🔽亦聽有沙石棘刺之處，著重底革屣；
analyzed: 「從今聽阿濕波阿雲頭國及一切邊地少比丘處，持律五人授具足戒； 亦聽有沙石棘刺之處，著重底革屣；
translated: From now on, I allow in Aśvaka, Avyūha, and other border regions with few monks, that the full ordination be given by a group of five who uphold the precepts;🔽I also allow that in places with sand, gravel, and thorns, one may wear shoes with thick soles;

original: 亦聽有皮革處，作皮敷臥具；
analyzed: 亦聽有皮革處，作皮敷臥具；
translated: I also allow that in places where leather is available, one may make leather mats and bedding;

original: 亦聽有須浴處，日日洗浴；
analyzed: 亦聽有須浴處，日日洗浴；
translated: I also allow that in places where bathing is necessary, one may bathe every day;

original: 若比丘寄衣與餘處比丘，比丘雖先聞知，衣未入手不犯長衣。
analyzed: 若比丘寄衣與餘處比丘，比丘雖先聞知，衣未入手不犯長衣。
translated: If a monk entrusts his robes to other monks in another place, even if the monk has heard about it beforehand, if the robes have not yet been received, he does not violate the rule on extra robes.

original: 」爾時諸比丘作種種形、種種色革屣。
analyzed: 」爾時諸比丘作種種形、種種色革屣。
translated: At that time the bhikṣus made sandals of various shapes and colors.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:

original: 「不聽作異形、異色革屣，犯者突吉羅！
analyzed: 「不聽作異形、異色革屣，犯者突吉羅！
translated: You are not allowed to make sandals of different shapes and colors. Those who violate this are duṣkṛtas.

original: 」有諸比丘作馬皮、象皮、人皮革屣。
analyzed: 」有諸比丘作馬皮、象皮、人皮革屣。
translated: There were bhikṣus who made sandals of horsehide, elephant hide, and human skin.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
It is not allowed!
If you use human skin, it is a sthūlātyaya offense;
if you use horse or elephant skin, it is a duṣkṛta offense.

original: 」時跋難陀常出入一牧牛家，著衣持鉢往到其舍。
analyzed: 」時跋難陀常出入一牧牛家，著衣持鉢往到其舍。
translated: At that time, Balanduo always went in and out of a cow herder's house. He put on his robe and took his bowl to go to his house.

original: 彼有斑色犢子，跋難陀諦視生念，欲得此皮作敷具。
analyzed: 彼有斑色犢子，跋難陀諦視生念，欲得此皮作敷具。
translated: There was a dappled calf. Balanduo stared at it, thinking of getting its skin to make a sitting mat.
The host asked:
Why are you staring at this calf?
He replied:
This calf's dappled color is lovely. It would be suitable to make a sitting mat.
He then said:🔽If you give me this calf, I will give you a good blessing.

original: 「大德常料理我家，豈惜一犢而不相與！
analyzed: 「大德常料理我家，豈惜一犢而不相與！
translated: Venerable One, you always take care of my family. How could I begrudge a calf and not give it to you?
He then killed the calf in front of its mother and gave it to him.

original: 跋難陀得已持還僧坊，犢母隨後悲鳴逐之。
analyzed: 跋難陀得已持還僧坊，犢母隨後悲鳴逐之。
translated: After obtaining it, Balandada brought it back to the monastery, and the calf's mother followed behind, mooing sadly.
The bhikṣus asked:
Why is this cow mooing sadly and following you?
He replied:
I don't know.
They asked again:

original: 「此牛逐汝，不逐餘人，云何不知？
analyzed: 「此牛逐汝，不逐餘人，云何不知？
translated: This cow follows you, not others. How can you not know?
He then explained the matter in detail.

original: 諸比丘種種呵責，以是白佛。
analyzed: 諸比丘種種呵責，以是白佛。
translated: The bhikṣus reprimanded him in various ways and reported it to the Buddha.

original: 佛以是事集比丘僧，問跋難陀：
analyzed: 佛以是事集比丘僧，問跋難陀：
translated: The Buddha assembled the community of bhikṣus because of this matter and asked Balandada:
Is it really so?
He replied:
It is really so, World-Honored One!
After reprimanding him in various ways, the Buddha told the bhikṣus:
From now on, it is not permitted to keep any kind of skin!

original: 」諸比丘後須小片皮而不敢用，以是白佛，佛言：
analyzed: 」諸比丘後須小片皮而不敢用，以是白佛，佛言：
translated: Later, the bhikṣus needed a small piece of leather but did not dare to use it. They reported this to the Buddha, who said:
You are allowed to use small pieces of leather to make things.

original: 」有諸比丘從外還，徒跣上僧臥具，污泥不淨。
analyzed: 」有諸比丘從外還，徒跣上僧臥具，污泥不淨。
translated: Some bhikṣus returned from outside, barefoot, and stepped on the saṃgha's bedding, dirtying and defiling it.
They reported this to the Buddha, who said:
You are allowed to wear sandals when going out.

original: 」有老病比丘於恐怖處共伴道行，遲不相及，諸伴語：
analyzed: 」有老病比丘於恐怖處共伴道行，遲不相及，諸伴語：
translated: There were old and sick bhikṣus who were traveling with companions on a dangerous road. They were slow and could not keep up with their companions, who said:
Venerable ones, walk faster so you don't get stripped!
They replied:
We are old and sick and cannot walk!
Their companions said:

original: 「此有象、馬、驢騾、駱駝、車、牛，可騎乘。
analyzed: 「此有象、馬、驢騾、駱駝、車、牛，可騎乘。
translated: There are elephants, horses, donkeys, mules, camels, carts, and oxen here. You can ride them.
The bhikṣus did not dare to, so they reported this to the Buddha, who said:

original: 「從今聽老病比丘騎乘，但不得乘騎雌畜生。
analyzed: 「從今聽老病比丘騎乘，但不得乘騎雌畜生。
translated: From now on, old and sick bhikṣus are allowed to ride, but they are not allowed to ride female animals.

original: 」有諸白衣以皮輿施僧，諸比丘不敢受。
analyzed: 」有諸白衣以皮輿施僧，諸比丘不敢受。
translated: Some laypeople offered leather palanquins to the monks, but the monks did not dare to accept them.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
Allow you to accept them.
Remove the leather and use the remaining cloth.

original: 」有諸白衣以皮輿別施上座，不敢受。
analyzed: 」有諸白衣以皮輿別施上座，不敢受。
translated: Some laypeople separately offered leather palanquins to the senior monks, but they did not dare to accept them.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
Also allow you to privately accept them, and remove the leather as explained above.

original: 」諸上座老病比丘，欲乘輿入聚落，不敢乘。
analyzed: 」諸上座老病比丘，欲乘輿入聚落，不敢乘。
translated: Elder and sick monks wanted to ride palanquins into the village, but they did not dare to ride them.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
Allow it.

original: 」不知使誰輿之，以是白佛，佛言：
analyzed: 」不知使誰輿之，以是白佛，佛言：
translated: They did not know who to have carry them, so they reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
Have a layman carry them.

original: 」有諸比丘於恐怖處，欲渡水無船。
analyzed: 」有諸比丘於恐怖處，欲渡水無船。
translated: Some monks were in a frightening place and wanted to cross the water without a boat.

original: 有牧牛人驅牛渡水，語言：
analyzed: 有牧牛人驅牛渡水，語言：
translated: There were cowherds driving cattle across the water, who said:
You can grab the cow's tail.
The monks did not dare to, so they reported this to the Buddha.
The Buddha said:
Allow you to grab it.

original: 」時六群比丘捉牸牛尾渡水，以手刺其瘡中。
analyzed: 」時六群比丘捉牸牛尾渡水，以手刺其瘡中。
translated: At that time, the group of six monks held the tail of a cow and crossed the water, stabbing its wound with their hands.
They reported this to the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
You are not allowed to hold the tail of a female animal and cross the water.

original: 」有諸比丘欲渡水，亦無畜生可捉，不知云何，以是白佛。
analyzed: 」有諸比丘欲渡水，亦無畜生可捉，不知云何，以是白佛。
translated: There were monks who wanted to cross the water, but there were no animals to hold. They did not know what to do, so they reported this to the Buddha.
The Buddha said:
You are allowed to tie grass and wood together to make a raft.

original: 自今聽諸比丘畜浮囊，若羊皮、若牛皮作。
analyzed: 自今聽諸比丘畜浮囊，若羊皮、若牛皮作。
translated: From now on, I allow the monks to keep floats, made of either sheepskin or cowhide.
Both the Sangha and the Sangha of the four directions should keep them.
The Buddha was in Rājagṛha.

original: 爾時瓶沙王摩竭、鴦伽二國，有四萬二千聚落，彼諸豪傑無有不信佛法僧者；
analyzed: 爾時瓶沙王摩竭、鴦伽二國，有四萬二千聚落，彼諸豪傑無有不信佛法僧者；
translated: At that time, King Bimbisāra of Magadha and Aṅga had 42,000 villages. Among the powerful people there, there was no one who did not have faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha;

original: 唯除瞻婆城中，有長者子名首樓那，其人大富有二十億錢，時人號曰首樓那二十億，是人生便受樂，手脚柔軟，足下生毛。
analyzed: 唯除瞻婆城中，有長者子名首樓那，其人大富有二十億錢，時人號曰首樓那二十億，是人生便受樂，手脚柔軟，足下生毛。
translated: Except for the son of an elder in the city of Campā, named Śreṇiya, who was very wealthy with twenty koṭis of coins, at that time people called him Śreṇiya the Twenty Koṭis. This person was born to enjoy happiness, with soft hands and feet, and hair growing on the soles of his feet.
King Bimbisāra had this thought:

original: 「我界內唯有二十億未信佛法，我當云何令彼信樂？
analyzed: 「我界內唯有二十億未信佛法，我當云何令彼信樂？
translated: In my realm, there is only the Twenty Koṭis who has not yet believed in the Buddha's teachings. How can I make him believe and delight in it?
If I go myself, he will be greatly startled;
if I summon him, he will certainly have doubts and fears.

original: 正當通命瞻婆城中六十家諸豪傑，觀王子婚，因此相見，誨以道法。
analyzed: 正當通命瞻婆城中六十家諸豪傑，觀王子婚，因此相見，誨以道法。
translated: I should invite the sixty prominent families of the city of Campā to witness the prince's marriage. In this way, I can meet him and teach him the way of the Dharma.
Having thought this, he immediately summoned them.
At that time, all the relatives said to the king:

original: 「二十億未曾履地，足下生毛如人頂髮，不堪恭到。
analyzed: 「二十億未曾履地，足下生毛如人頂髮，不堪恭到。
translated: The Twenty Koṭis has never stepped on the ground, and hair grows on the soles of his feet like the hair on a person's head. He is not fit to come in person.
Please, Your Majesty, spare this one person!
The king said:
You can ride elephants, horses, and carriages.
He replied:
My body is extremely delicate, and I cannot bear it.
The king said:

original: 「今王子婚，必宜相見，聽汝親族盡自致方！
analyzed: 「今王子婚，必宜相見，聽汝親族盡自致方！
translated: Now the prince is getting married, we must meet each other. I allow your relatives to find a way to bring you here!
The relatives discussed together:

original: 「唯當鑿渠通船，日行數里，乃可不勞，恭王命耳！
analyzed: 「唯當鑿渠通船，日行數里，乃可不勞，恭王命耳！
translated: We should only dig a canal to pass boats, traveling a few li each day, then we will not tire and will respectfully follow the king's order!

original: 」便共以此致之，到王舍城，親族白王：
analyzed: 」便共以此致之，到王舍城，親族白王：
translated: They then all did this to bring him there, and he arrived at Rājagṛha. The relatives said to the king:

original: 「二十億今始得至，願聽如家法！
analyzed: 「二十億今始得至，願聽如家法！
translated: Viśākhā has just now arrived. Please allow her to follow her family's customs!
The king said:
What are your family's customs?
He replied:
Spread out clothes on the ground and carry her over them.
The king said:
That is acceptable!
He then ordered them to do so;

original: 又為敷細軟衣為座，令坐其上。
analyzed: 又為敷細軟衣為座，令坐其上。
translated: and also spread out soft clothes as a seat for her to sit on.
The king asked:
Is it true that hair grows on the soles of your feet?
He replied:🔽Yes, it is true.
It is true.
Great King!
The king said:
I want to see it.
He replied:
Please let a trustworthy person look at it.
The king said:
I want to see it myself.
He replied:
Please allow me to stretch out my legs.
The king said:
So be it!
He then stretched out his legs to show the king.

original: 果如所聞，光曜王目不得熟視，生希有心，念言：
analyzed: 果如所聞，光曜王目不得熟視，生希有心，念言：
translated: The fruit was just as he had heard, shining brightly and dazzling the king's eyes, unable to look at it for long. He gave rise to a rare thought, thinking:
In my country, there is born such a greatly meritorious person!

original: 」顧視左右，先有三大居士，并二十億為四。
analyzed: 」顧視左右，先有三大居士，并二十億為四。
translated: He looked to his left and right, and there were originally three great householders, together with twenty koṭis, making four.
He asked:
Each of you has how much wealth to be considered a householder?
The first person said:
I have thirteen koṭis of coins.
The second person said:
I have fourteen koṭis.
The third person said:

original: 「我有十四億，又有一無價摩尼珠。
analyzed: 「我有十四億，又有一無價摩尼珠。
translated: I have fourteen koṭis, and also a priceless maṇi pearl.
Ekaśṛṅga said:

original: 「我有二十億，復有五百摩尼珠，一摩尼寶床。
analyzed: 「我有二十億，復有五百摩尼珠，一摩尼寶床。
translated: I have twenty koṭis, and also five hundred maṇi pearls and a maṇi jewel bed.
The king asked Ekaśṛṅga:
Where did you get these?
He replied:
These treasures are not from my father or other relatives, nor did I earn them through work.

original: 我於高樓上眠，眠覺便在我前。
analyzed: 我於高樓上眠，眠覺便在我前。
translated: While I was sleeping on the high building, I woke up and they were in front of me.
When the king heard this, he became even more astonished.
He thought again:

original: 「此人福德，唯佛當知，餘無能了。
analyzed: 「此人福德，唯佛當知，餘無能了。
translated: Only the Buddha can know this person's blessings and virtues, no one else can understand.

original: 」即便嚴駕，出詣佛所，頭面禮足，白佛言：
analyzed: 」即便嚴駕，出詣佛所，頭面禮足，白佛言：
translated: He then prepared his carriage and went to where the Buddha was. He bowed his head to the Buddha's feet and said to the Buddha:
World-Honored One!

original: 二十億有五百摩尼珠、一摩尼寶床，從何而來？
analyzed: 二十億有五百摩尼珠、一摩尼寶床，從何而來？
translated: Where did Ekaśṛṅga's five hundred maṇi pearls and maṇi jewel bed come from?
The Buddha said:🔽Good man!

original: 「此人先在忉利天，有五百天女，極相愛樂。
analyzed: 「此人先在忉利天，有五百天女，極相愛樂。
translated: This person was previously in the Heaven of the Thirty-three, with five hundred celestial maidens, who loved him deeply.
When he came to be born here, the celestial maidens all thought:
'Where has our celestial son been born now?'

original: 』以天眼觀，見生在此，各持一摩尼珠及先所臥寶床，化令稱其今身，著前而去。
analyzed: 』以天眼觀，見生在此，各持一摩尼珠及先所臥寶床，化令稱其今身，著前而去。
translated: Using their celestial eyes, they saw that he was born here, and each took a maṇi pearl and the jeweled bed they had previously lain on, transformed to fit their present bodies, and left.

original: 」王聞佛說，禮畢退還，集瞻婆城六十豪傑，語言：
analyzed: 」王聞佛說，禮畢退還，集瞻婆城六十豪傑，語言：
translated: The king heard the Buddha's explanation, made obeisance, and withdrew. He gathered the sixty most prominent people in Campā City and said to them:

original: 「我今令二十億為彼城中最大居士，汝等宗之。
analyzed: 「我今令二十億為彼城中最大居士，汝等宗之。
translated: I now order Viśākhā to be the greatest householder in that city. You should respect him.
He also said to Viśākhā and the sixty people:

original: 「我為汝王，以法治化，已與汝等作現世利益。
analyzed: 「我為汝王，以法治化，已與汝等作現世利益。
translated: I am your king, ruling with the Dharma, and have already brought present-life benefits to you all.

original: 今佛世尊在耆闍崛山，各可往彼求後世利。
analyzed: 今佛世尊在耆闍崛山，各可往彼求後世利。
translated: Now the World-Honored Buddha is at Gṛdhrakūṭa Mountain. Each of you should go there to seek future-life benefits.
Receiving the order, they all went.

original: 時長老娑竭陀，於山中盤石上經行，諸居士到其所語言：
analyzed: 時長老娑竭陀，於山中盤石上經行，諸居士到其所語言：
translated: At that time, the elder Sāgata was walking on a flat rock in the mountains. The laypeople came to him and said:
Venerable!

original: 為我白佛，瞻婆城二十億及六十居士欲問訊世尊。
analyzed: 為我白佛，瞻婆城二十億及六十居士欲問訊世尊。
translated: Please tell the Buddha for us that the twenty koṭis and sixty laypeople in Campā wish to ask about the World-Honored One's well-being.

original: 」娑竭陀於盤石上、居士前沒，踊出佛前，具以白佛。
analyzed: 」娑竭陀於盤石上、居士前沒，踊出佛前，具以白佛。
translated: Sāgata disappeared from the flat rock in front of the laypeople and emerged in front of the Buddha, and fully informed the Buddha.
The Buddha said:

original: 「汝可先去，於盤石上敷座，吾尋後往。
analyzed: 「汝可先去，於盤石上敷座，吾尋後往。
translated: You may go first and set out seats on the flat rock. I will come after you.

original: 」受教，於佛前沒，踊出盤石、眾居士前，為佛敷座；
analyzed: 」受教，於佛前沒，踊出盤石、眾居士前，為佛敷座；
translated: Following the instruction, he disappeared in front of the Buddha, emerged on the flat rock in front of the laypeople, and set out seats for the Buddha;
The Buddha, with his usual dignified demeanor, walked after him and arrived.
The laypeople thought:

original: 「此比丘有大神力，出沒盤石，猶如入水。
analyzed: 「此比丘有大神力，出沒盤石，猶如入水。
translated: This bhikṣu has great spiritual powers, emerging from the flat rock as if entering water.
They all respected him but looked down on the World-Honored One.
When the World-Honored One arrived, he sat down on the seat.

original: 諸佛常法，先使發歡喜心，然後說法。
analyzed: 諸佛常法，先使發歡喜心，然後說法。
translated: It is the constant practice of the Buddhas to first cause them to give rise to a joyful mind, and then expound the Dharma.
The Buddha said to Sāgata:
You rise up and fan the Buddha!

original: 」受教起扇，須臾現種種神變，如優為迦葉。
analyzed: 」受教起扇，須臾現種種神變，如優為迦葉。
translated: Following the instruction, he rose and fanned, and in an instant manifested various spiritual transformations, just like Upagupta.

original: 還在佛前，稽首禮足，白佛言：
analyzed: 還在佛前，稽首禮足，白佛言：
translated: He returned to the Buddha's presence, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, and said to the Buddha:
The Buddha is my great teacher, and I am the Buddha's disciple.
In this way, he repeated it three times, and then sat back in his original position.
At this, the laypeople had this thought:

original: 「弟子神力猶尚如是，況於如來、應供、等正覺！
analyzed: 「弟子神力猶尚如是，況於如來、應供、等正覺！
translated: The disciple's spiritual powers are still like this, let alone the Tathāgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One!
They then turned their minds and looked up in admiration.

original: 佛為說種種妙法，示教利喜，乃至苦集盡道，皆於坐上得法眼淨，受三歸五戒。
analyzed: 佛為說種種妙法，示教利喜，乃至苦集盡道，皆於坐上得法眼淨，受三歸五戒。
translated: The Buddha expounded various wonderful Dharmas for them, teaching, benefiting, and delighting them, up to the end of suffering and the path of accumulation, and they all attained the pure Dharma eye while sitting there, and accepted the three refuges and five precepts.

original: 二十億從坐起，跣足至佛前稽首作禮，佛便微笑。
analyzed: 二十億從坐起，跣足至佛前稽首作禮，佛便微笑。
translated: Ekoṇḍañña rose from his seat, went barefoot to the Buddha's presence, bowed his head in reverence, and the Buddha then smiled.
Sāgata thought:
For what reason did the Buddha smile?

original: 」念已，從坐起，偏袒右肩，䠒跪白佛：
analyzed: 」念已，從坐起，偏袒右肩，䠒跪白佛：
translated: Having thought this, he rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder, knelt on his right knee, and said to the Buddha:
For what reason did you emit this smile?
The Buddha said to Sāgata:

original: 「此二十億九十一劫來，始今足蹈於地。
analyzed: 「此二十億九十一劫來，始今足蹈於地。
translated: For twenty koṭīs and ninety-one kalpas, he has only now set his foot on the ground.
He also asked:

original: 「二十億何因緣，九十一劫足不蹈地？
analyzed: 「二十億何因緣，九十一劫足不蹈地？
translated: For what reason has Sāgata not set his foot on the ground for ninety-one kalpas?
The Buddha said:

original: 「過去世時，有佛世尊出現於世，名毘婆尸；
analyzed: 「過去世時，有佛世尊出現於世，名毘婆尸；
translated: In a past life, a Buddha-World-Honored One appeared in the world, named Vipaśyin;

original: 父王治城，長十二由旬，廣七由旬，多諸人眾安隱豐樂。
analyzed: 父王治城，長十二由旬，廣七由旬，多諸人眾安隱豐樂。
translated: The king's city was twelve yojanas long and seven yojanas wide, with many people living in it, peaceful and prosperous.

original: 彼佛與大比丘僧六萬八千人俱，皆是阿羅漢於彼止住，其王日日請佛及僧於宮中食。
analyzed: 彼佛與大比丘僧六萬八千人俱，皆是阿羅漢於彼止住，其王日日請佛及僧於宮中食。
translated: That Buddha was together with a great assembly of sixty-eight thousand bhikṣus, all of whom were arhats. He stayed there, and the king invited the Buddha and the saṅgha to the palace for meals every day.

original: 時大眾中有一人名修毘賒，共眾人往詣王所，白言：
analyzed: 時大眾中有一人名修毘賒，共眾人往詣王所，白言：
translated: At that time, there was a person in the great assembly named Xiu Bisheng who went to the king together with the others and said:

original: 『王今作諸功德，願聽我等亦得豫之！
analyzed: 『王今作諸功德，願聽我等亦得豫之！
translated: The king is now making various merits. Please allow us to participate as well!
The king said:

original: 『今佛僧眾有六萬八千人，恐汝等不辦，或更惱僧。
analyzed: 『今佛僧眾有六萬八千人，恐汝等不辦，或更惱僧。
translated: There are now 68,000 people in the Buddha's Sangha. I'm afraid you won't be able to handle it and may disturb the Sangha again.
They further said to the king:
We can handle it ourselves. Please be sure to allow it!
The king said:
Very good!
Fearing they still wouldn't be able to handle it, he ordered food to be prepared as usual:
If they can't manage it, we can supplement it.
Then the people prepared offerings that surpassed the king's food;

original: 如是多日，王所作食竟不復設。
analyzed: 如是多日，王所作食竟不復設。
translated: In this way, for many days, the king's prepared food was never used.

original: 修毘賒次應設供，使人掘路，更以細軟土填，香泥泥之；
analyzed: 修毘賒次應設供，使人掘路，更以細軟土填，香泥泥之；
translated: Xiu Bisheng was next in line to prepare offerings. He had people dig up the road and fill it with fine soft soil, then smear it with fragrant mud;

original: 兩邊竪八十寶柱，以雜色摩尼珠置於柱頭，懸雜色幡，張雜色幔，彌覆路上處處，路上安種種漿。
analyzed: 兩邊竪八十寶柱，以雜色摩尼珠置於柱頭，懸雜色幡，張雜色幔，彌覆路上處處，路上安種種漿。
translated: On both sides, eighty jeweled pillars were erected, with variously colored maṇi jewels placed on top of the pillars, and variously colored banners hung. Variously colored curtains were spread, covering the road everywhere. On the road, various kinds of drinks were placed.

original: 於家敷六萬八千座，一比丘坐一座，各以五百釜羹而供養之；
analyzed: 於家敷六萬八千座，一比丘坐一座，各以五百釜羹而供養之；
translated: In the house, 68,000 seats were arranged. Each bhikṣu sat on one seat and was offered food from 500 cauldrons.

original: 一一比丘施劫貝二張，革屣一緉。
analyzed: 一一比丘施劫貝二張，革屣一緉。
translated: To each bhikṣu, two bolts of silk and a pair of leather shoes were given as offerings.

original: 復為四方僧作一房，地敷臥具，皆悉妙好。
analyzed: 復為四方僧作一房，地敷臥具，皆悉妙好。
translated: A room was also built for the monks from the four directions, with bedding laid out on the ground, all of the finest quality.

original: 爾時修毘賒者，今二十億是。
analyzed: 爾時修毘賒者，今二十億是。
translated: At that time, the one who practiced giving was now Bhadrapāla.

original: 從是已後，受天上人中福等無有異。
analyzed: 從是已後，受天上人中福等無有異。
translated: From then on, he received blessings in the heavens and among humans, no different from before.

original: 若今不見我者，足猶不蹈地。
analyzed: 若今不見我者，足猶不蹈地。
translated: If he had not seen me now, his feet would still not have touched the ground.
At that time, Bhadrapāla knelt and said to the Buddha:
Please allow me to go forth and receive the full precepts!
The Buddha said:
Have your parents given you permission yet?
He replied:
No, they have not.
The Buddha said:
If your parents do not give their permission, you cannot go forth.
He replied:
I will return home and inform my parents.
The Buddha said:
Excellent!
Now is the right time.

original: 」於是二十億禮佛足，右遶，還瞻婆城，白其母言：
analyzed: 」於是二十億禮佛足，右遶，還瞻婆城，白其母言：
translated: Then Viśākhā paid homage at the Buddha's feet, circumambulated him to the right, and returned to the city of Campā. He said to his mother:
I now wish to go forth and study the path.
His mother said:
Stop, stop!
Why do you want to go forth?

original: 我唯有汝，死尚不欲相離，如何生離？
analyzed: 我唯有汝，死尚不欲相離，如何生離？
translated: I have only you. I do not want to be separated from you even in death, so how can I bear to be separated from you in life?

original: 今我財物、珍寶、奴婢、田宅無有限數，可恣意作福，受五欲樂。
analyzed: 今我財物、珍寶、奴婢、田宅無有限數，可恣意作福，受五欲樂。
translated: I have countless wealth, treasures, servants, fields, and houses. You can indulge in making merit and enjoy the five desires.
He pleaded insistently three times, and only then did she give her permission.

original: 前禮母足，右遶三匝，還詣佛所，頭面禮足，䠒跪白佛：
analyzed: 前禮母足，右遶三匝，還詣佛所，頭面禮足，䠒跪白佛：
translated: He then bowed at his mother's feet, circumambulated her three times to the right, and returned to where the Buddha was. He paid homage at the Buddha's feet, knelt with palms joined, and said to the Buddha:

original: 「母已聽許，願便與我出家受具足戒！
analyzed: 「母已聽許，願便與我出家受具足戒！
translated: Mother has already given her consent. I wish to leave the household life and receive the full precepts!
The Buddha said:
Come, bhikṣus!

original: 出家受具足戒，廣修梵行；
analyzed: 出家受具足戒，廣修梵行；
translated: Leave the household life and receive the full precepts, and extensively cultivate the pure practices.
I will skillfully expound the Dharma and enable you to end the source of suffering.

original: 」說是語時，二十億鬚髮自墮，僧伽梨著身，鉢盂在手。
analyzed: 」說是語時，二十億鬚髮自墮，僧伽梨著身，鉢盂在手。
translated: When these words were spoken, the twenty koṭis' hair and beards automatically fell out, saṃghāṭī robes were placed on their bodies, and alms bowls were in their hands.

original: 出家不久，於尸陀林精進經行，足傷血流，烏隨啄吞。
analyzed: 出家不久，於尸陀林精進經行，足傷血流，烏隨啄吞。
translated: Not long after leaving the household life, they were diligently walking in meditation in the cremation ground, their feet were injured and blood flowed, and crows followed to peck and swallow it.
The twenty koṭis had this thought:

original: 「佛弟子中精進無勝我者，而今未得盡諸苦源。
analyzed: 「佛弟子中精進無勝我者，而今未得盡諸苦源。
translated: Among the Buddha's disciples, none surpasses me in diligence, yet now I have not yet attained the end of all suffering.

original: 我家幸多財寶，亦可反俗快作功德。
analyzed: 我家幸多財寶，亦可反俗快作功德。
translated: My family fortunately has much wealth and treasures, and I can also return to lay life and quickly create merit.

original: 」佛知其念，從耆闍崛山來下，見烏啄吞其血。
analyzed: 」佛知其念，從耆闍崛山來下，見烏啄吞其血。
translated: The Buddha knew his thoughts, came down from Gṛdhrakūṭa Mountain, and saw crows pecking and swallowing his blood.
He asked Ānanda:
Why is there this blood, with crows competing to peck at it?
He replied:🔽This is the blood of the twenty koṭis.
Viśākhā is walking on this scripture, and her feet are injured and bleeding.
The World-Honored One then went to her and asked Viśākhā:
Is it true that you have this thought?
She replied:
It is true.
World-Honored One!
The Buddha said again:
I will now ask you, answer me as you wish.
Did you play the lute well when you were at home?
She replied:
Well!
He asked again:
When the strings of the lute are tight, is the tune good?
She replied:
It is not good!
He asked again:
When the strings of the lute are loose, is the tune good?
She replied:
It is not good!
He asked again:
What is good then?
She replied:
Neither too tight nor too loose, then it is good.
The Buddha said:

original: 「於我法中亦復如是，太緩、太急，何緣得道？
analyzed: 「於我法中亦復如是，太緩、太急，何緣得道？
translated: It is the same in my Dharma. If one is too lax or too tense, how can one attain the Way?
If one practices diligently with balance, one will soon end suffering.

original: 」二十億聞佛說已，即於經行處，漏盡無餘。
analyzed: 」二十億聞佛說已，即於經行處，漏盡無餘。
translated: When Tiṣya heard what the Buddha said, he immediately attained arhatship, with no further defilements.

original: 世尊以二十億足下傷破，告諸比丘：
analyzed: 世尊以二十億足下傷破，告諸比丘：
translated: The World-Honored One's feet were injured by Tiṣya's twenty koṭis of gold coins, and he told the bhikṣus:
Now I allow Tiṣya to wear single-layered leather shoes.
Tiṣya said to the Buddha:
World-Honored One!

original: 我捨二十億錢，五百摩尼寶珠，一摩尼寶床，二十夫人，無量婇女。
analyzed: 我捨二十億錢，五百摩尼寶珠，一摩尼寶床，二十夫人，無量婇女。
translated: I have given up twenty koṭis of gold coins, five hundred maṇi jewels, a maṇi jewel bed, twenty wives, and countless concubines.

original: 若著一重革屣，人當譏我：
analyzed: 若著一重革屣，人當譏我：
translated: If I wear single-layered leather shoes, people will criticize me, saying:

original: 『捨如此財寶，而猶貪受一重革屣。
analyzed: 『捨如此財寶，而猶貪受一重革屣。
translated: 'He has given up such wealth and treasures, yet still greedily accepts single-layered leather shoes.'

original: 』世尊若聽一切比丘著者，我當著之。
analyzed: 』世尊若聽一切比丘著者，我當著之。
translated: World-Honored One, if you allow all bhikṣus to wear them, then I will wear them.

original: 」佛便讚歎少欲知足、讚戒、讚持戒已，告諸比丘：
analyzed: 」佛便讚歎少欲知足、讚戒、讚持戒已，告諸比丘：
translated: The Buddha then praised having few desires and contentment, praised the precepts, and praised upholding the precepts. He told the monks:
From now on, monks are allowed to wear single-layered leather shoes.

original: 」有諸比丘著兩重革屣，以是白佛，佛言：
analyzed: 」有諸比丘著兩重革屣，以是白佛，佛言：
translated: Some monks wore double-layered leather shoes. They told the Buddha, and the Buddha said:
It is not allowed. Those who violate this commit a duṣkṛta offense!

original: 」時六群比丘著革屣在和尚、阿闍梨前後經行，有餘比丘亦皆效之。
analyzed: 」時六群比丘著革屣在和尚、阿闍梨前後經行，有餘比丘亦皆效之。
translated: At that time, the group of six monks wore leather shoes while walking in front of and behind their preceptors and teachers. Other monks also imitated them.
The monks told the Buddha, and the Buddha said:

original: 「不應和尚、阿闍梨前著革屣，犯者突吉羅！
analyzed: 「不應和尚、阿闍梨前著革屣，犯者突吉羅！
translated: One should not wear leather shoes in front of one's preceptor or teacher. Those who violate this commit a duṣkṛta offense!

original: 有因緣於和尚、阿闍梨前著革屣無犯。
analyzed: 有因緣於和尚、阿闍梨前著革屣無犯。
translated: There is no offense if there is a reason to wear leather shoes in front of one's preceptor or teacher.

original: 若地有棘刺、若地有刺脚草、若地有沙石、若病時、若闇時。
analyzed: 若地有棘刺、若地有刺脚草、若地有沙石、若病時、若闇時。
